name: Subhransu Maji
content: subhransu maji - umass amherst - computer vision Subhransu Maji Professor CICS, UMass Amherst smaji@cs.umass.edu office: 274 cs home group research teaching About me I am Professor in the Manning College of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, where I also serve as Co-Director of the Computer Vision Lab. Prior to joining UMass Amherst, I was a Research Assistant Professor at TTI Chicago. I obtained my PhD under the supervision of Jitendra Malik from the University of California, Berkeley, in 2011, and a BTech in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kanpur in 2006. In the past, I have enjoyed working at the University of Amsterdam, AWS AI, Google, INRIA, Microsoft Research, the CLSP Center at JHU, and Oxford University. My research is funded by the National Science Foundation, including a CAREER award, NASA, and awards from Climate Change AI, Facebook, NVIDIA, Dolby, and Adobe. My research focuses on high-level visual recognition algorithms. I am also interested in AI applications for science, particularly in ecology and remote sensing. For an overview of my research, take a look at my recent publications, CV, and research statement (visualized as a word cloud). I am also on Google Scholar.
